required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of a Smartphone Based Diagnostic Tool to Assess Neonatal Jaundice in a Mexican Population
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of a Smartphone Based Diagnostic Tool to Assess Neonatal Jaundice in a Mexican Population

collaborator.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences Department of Public Health and Nursing

brief_summary.textblock: This corss-sectional study aims to test the performance and accuracy of the Picterus JP screening device in newborns with different skin types.

detailed_description.textblock:
A descriptive cross-sectional study among 174 newborns was carried out at Hospital Materno-Infantil de Irapuato in Mexico during July and August 2018.
The Picterus Calibration Card will be placed on the chest of the newborn with the hole in the card placed over the infant's sternum. A validated smartphone with Picterus JP will be used to collect digital images..

primary_outcome.measure: Enable high qualitative estimation of bilirubin levels in the blood of newborns using Picterus JP
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate of smartphone-based diagnostic tool (Picterus JP) for neonatal jaundice in newborns.

secondary_outcome.description: Demonstrate the correlation among the estimated levels of bilirubin obtained through a smartphone based diagnostic tool with bilirubin serum levels in a population of Mexican neonates.

Demonstrate the correlation among the estimated levels of bilirubin obtained through a smartphone based diagnostic tool with those obtained using a transcutaneous bilirubinometer in a population of Mexican neonates.

Demonstrate the correlation among the estimated levels of bilirubin obtained through a smartphone based diagnostic tool with those obtained using visual Kramer scale in a population of Mexican neonates.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Enable high qualitative estimation of bilirubin levels in the blood of new-borns
arm_group.description: There is only one arm in this study which is to enable high qualitative estimation of bilirubin levels in the blood of new-borns, independent of skin color, using Picterus JP.

intervention.description: Use Picterus Jaundice Pro, a smartphone app that is used to take photo of the newborns skin, where the Picterus calibration card is place.
intervention.arm_group_label: Enable high qualitative estimation of bilirubin levels in the blood of new-borns

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy newborns with or without signs of jaundice
- Gestational age >35 weeks
- Age 0-14 days
- Birth weight > 1500 g.
- Parents acceptance of their children to participate in the study.
- Newborn needing a blood test
Exclusion Criteria:
- Newborns showing signs or with diagnosis of inborn diseases
- Newborn transferred to pediatric ward for any treatment
- Newborns who had received phototherapy.

overall_official.affiliation: NTNU Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences, Department of Public Health and Nursing

link.description: Master thesis describing the study and its results
